original: bden pa yang dag par mthong bar 'gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bden pa yang dag par mthong bar 'gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that one will see the truth correctly.

original: gang gi phyir mthong ba'i lam mngon sum du ma byas pas ni gong ma'i lam bsgom pa las bzlog cing bcad par mi nus so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mthong ba'i lam mngon sum du ma byas pas ni gong ma'i lam bsgom pa las bzlog cing bcad par mi nus so //
translated: Because one cannot turn back and stop the cultivation of the higher path without realizing the path of insight.

original: gang de lta bu nyid ni bde ba 'thob pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir sems ni rab dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang de lta bu nyid ni bde ba 'thob pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir sems ni rab dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The mind that is clear, etc.

original: ka pi na chen po dag la rtag tu snying po med pas rtag tu snying po med pa la gso sbyong byed pa ste /
analyzed: ka pi na chen po dag la rtag tu snying po med pas rtag tu snying po med pa la gso sbyong byed pa ste /
translated: The great kapis are always without essence, and so they always lack essence.

original: de bas na gso sbyong la mngon par mi phyogs la mi 'ong zhing lam bsgom pa la mngon par mi dga' ba las brtsams so //
analyzed: de bas na gso sbyong la mngon par mi phyogs la mi 'ong zhing lam bsgom pa la mngon par mi dga' ba las brtsams so //
translated: Therefore, he does not approach or come to the purification of the bases, and he does not delight in cultivating the path.

original: gzhan dag ni bram ze ma thag res 'di skad du /üîΩsems ni rab tu dang ba yis //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni bram ze ma thag res 'di skad du / sems ni rab tu dang ba yis //
translated: Others say that the brahmin Tagara≈õikhin asked:

original: 'jig rten bde ba gang gis 'thob //üîΩ'phags pas bstan pa'i lam dag la //
analyzed: 'jig rten bde ba gang gis 'thob // 'phags pas bstan pa'i lam dag la //
translated: By what is worldly happiness obtained?üîΩBy what is one always delighted

original: gang zhig rtag tu dga' bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes zhus pas /
analyzed: gang zhig rtag tu dga' bar 'gyur // zhes zhus pas /
translated: in the path taught by the noble ones?

original: des 'di gsungs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: des 'di gsungs so zhes zer ro //
translated: He said the following in reply:

original: chos mngon par rtogs pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba ni chos la gnas pa'i dga' ba ste /
analyzed: chos mngon par rtogs pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba ni chos la gnas pa'i dga' ba ste /
translated: The joy born from realizing the Dharma is the joy of abiding in the Dharma.

original: des de bde bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: des de bde bar gnas pa'o //
translated: By that, one abides in happiness.

original: 'dir chos ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dir chos ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Here, the Dharma is the four aspects of the truth of suffering.

original: gang gis de la dga' ba nyams su myong ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis de la dga' ba nyams su myong ba yin zhe na /
translated: By what is one delighted?

original: sems ni rab tu rnam dang bas //üîΩzhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sems ni rab tu rnam dang bas // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: By the mind being completely purified.üîΩBy the mind being completely purified.

original: shes nas dad pa dang ldan pa'i phyir yid kyis chad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: shes nas dad pa dang ldan pa'i phyir yid kyis chad pa med pa'o //
translated: Because of having faith through knowledge, one is not discouraged by the mind.

original: 'phags pas gsungs pa'i lam dag la //
analyzed: 'phags pas gsungs pa'i lam dag la //
translated: On the paths taught by the noble ones.

original: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i thar pa thob pa'i lam la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i thar pa thob pa'i lam la'o //
translated: On the paths taught by the Tathagata for attaining liberation.

original: mkhas pa ni rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa ni rtogs pa ste /
translated: The wise one is the one who has realization.

original: lam dang lam ma yin pa'i khyad par shes pa'o //
analyzed: lam dang lam ma yin pa'i khyad par shes pa'o //
translated: He knows the difference between the path and what is not the path.

original: de las gzhan pa'i thar pa'i lam ma dmigs pas de nyid la rgyun du dga' bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i thar pa'i lam ma dmigs pas de nyid la rgyun du dga' bar byed pa ste /
translated: Since he does not see any other path to liberation than that, he delights in it continuously.

original: dogs nas mthong ba'i bya gru la mngon par dga' ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dogs nas mthong ba'i bya gru la mngon par dga' ba bzhin no //
translated: Like one who is afraid delights in seeing a boat.üîΩIn order to show that one who has the mind of delight in that is one who practices the alms of happiness,

original: gang de la mngon par dga' ba'i blo dang ldan pa ni bde ba'i bsod snyoms la spyod pa yin no zhes bstan @150b ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gang de la mngon par dga' ba'i blo dang ldan pa ni bde ba'i bsod snyoms la spyod pa yin no zhes bstan @150b ba'i phyir //
translated: he says:

original: gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩde nas dgon pa pa'i bsod snyoms pa dge slong rab tu mang pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so // de nas dgon pa pa'i bsod snyoms pa dge slong rab tu mang pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Those who and so on is stated.üîΩThen many monks who were forest-dwellers and alms-beggars said to the Blessed One, Venerable One, who are those who enjoy the alms of the country without fail and wear the Dharma robes?

original: btsun pa gang dag gis yul 'khor gyi bsod snyoms don yod par spyod cing chos gos 'chad pa lags zhes pa dang / ji tsam na de las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa gsungs so //
analyzed: btsun pa gang dag gis yul 'khor gyi bsod snyoms don yod par spyod cing chos gos 'chad pa lags zhes pa dang / ji tsam na de las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa gsungs so //
translated: And then, beginning with that, he spoke the verse: Those who and so on.

original: gang dag ces bya ba ni bdag nyid chen po dag go //
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba ni bdag nyid chen po dag go //
translated: Those who refers to the great beings.

original: sems ni bsam gtan dga' zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin dang sgom pa la 'dod pa thob pa ste /
analyzed: sems ni bsam gtan dga' zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin dang sgom pa la 'dod pa thob pa ste /
translated: The mind delights in concentration means attaining desire for meditative stabilization and cultivation.

original: de las mngon par brtson pas ni thar pa'i lam 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las mngon par brtson pas ni thar pa'i lam 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the path of liberation arises from that, one strives in it.

original: gang zhig skye med dga' ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang zhig skye med dga' ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for who delight in non-arising,

original: skye ba med pa'i sgra ni thar pa'i rnam grangs yin te /
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i sgra ni thar pa'i rnam grangs yin te /
translated: the term non-arising is a synonym for liberation.

original: gang du phung po len pa med pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas yin pas gang der lhag par 'dod cing dga' ba'o //
analyzed: gang du phung po len pa med pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas yin pas gang der lhag par 'dod cing dga' ba'o //
translated: Since the state of nirvana is the place where the aggregates are not taken up, one delights in and is fond of that place.

original: gang gi rim pas bsam gtan dang sgom pa la shin tu dga' ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi rim pas bsam gtan dang sgom pa la shin tu dga' ba yin zhe na /
translated: In what order does one delight in the meditative development of the meditative absorptions?

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness.

original: dga' ba zhes bya ba thams cad la sbyar ro //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes bya ba thams cad la sbyar ro //
translated: The word 'delight' should be applied in every instance.

original: lus la sogs pa la brtag pas yongs su 'jug cing mngon par dga' bas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa la brtag pas yongs su 'jug cing mngon par dga' bas 'jug pa'o //
translated: One engages in the investigation of the body etc. and one engages in the investigation with delight.

original: lus dang sems kyi chos ni tha dad pa nyid du brtag par bya'o zhes lung las bshad do //
analyzed: lus dang sems kyi chos ni tha dad pa nyid du brtag par bya'o zhes lung las bshad do //
translated: The body and mind are to be investigated as distinct.

original: de sgom pa yongs su rdzogs na ni zag pa med pa'i lam bsgom pa la yang sems mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de sgom pa yongs su rdzogs na ni zag pa med pa'i lam bsgom pa la yang sems mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, when the meditative development of the latter is complete, the mind delights in the meditative development of the supramundane path, he says:

original: byang chub yan lag bdun dag dang// zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub yan lag bdun dag dang// zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the seven factors of enlightenment.

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa zad la mi skye ba'i tshul gyi byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa zad la mi skye ba'i tshul gyi byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
translated: The enlightenment factor of right mindfulness, etc. are the enlightenment factors in the sense of leading to the realization of the extinction of the defilements and the non-arising of the defilements.

original: 'thob par byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'thob par byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: They are the cause for the attainment of enlightenment.

original: zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: zhes byas nas so //
translated: Thus,

original: gcig tu zag pa med pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag ni 'dir mthong ba'i lam du bstan to //
analyzed: gcig tu zag pa med pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag ni 'dir mthong ba'i lam du bstan to //
translated: because they are exclusively undefiled, the enlightenment factors are taught here in the path of seeing.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i shas che ba'i mthus ni 'di 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i shas che ba'i mthus ni 'di 'byung ba yin no //
translated: They arise through the power of the predominance of the cultivation of the foundations of mindfulness.

original: rdzu 'phrul 'thob pa'i mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir de ni bsgom pa'i lam bstan te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul 'thob pa'i mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir de ni bsgom pa'i lam bstan te /
translated: The path of cultivation is taught because it is the sign of the attainment of supernatural power.

original: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa bzhi rnams dang // zhes bya ba bdun pa dang / brtson @151a * //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa bzhi rnams dang // zhes bya ba bdun pa dang / brtson @151a * //
translated: The four bases of supernatural power,

original: 'grus dang / dpyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba'i ming can dag go //
analyzed: 'grus dang / dpyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba'i ming can dag go //
translated: which are called the four bases of supernatural power, vigor, investigation, and concentration.

original: lam yan lag brgyad ces bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam dag go //
analyzed: lam yan lag brgyad ces bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam dag go //
translated: The eightfold noble path is the noble path.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i phyir mi slob pa'i lam dang zag pa med pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i phyir mi slob pa'i lam dang zag pa med pa'i lam mo //
translated: The path of no-more-learning and the uncontaminated path are the path of comfort in this life.

original: gang dga' ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par dga' ba skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gang dga' ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par dga' ba skyes pa'o //
translated: The phrase those who delight means those who have generated delight.

original: de dag bsod snyoms bde bar za bar byed //
analyzed: de dag bsod snyoms bde bar za bar byed //
translated: They enjoy the comfort of alms.

original: ces bya ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bza' ba dang btung ba bu lon med par longs su longs spyod ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bza' ba dang btung ba bu lon med par longs su longs spyod ba'o //
translated: The phrase they enjoy the comfort of alms means that they enjoy the use of food and drink that is free of any offense.

original: chos gos 'chang ba dang zhes bya ba ni sdom brtson dag gyon zhing 'chang ba'i gos dag go //
analyzed: chos gos 'chang ba dang zhes bya ba ni sdom brtson dag gyon zhing 'chang ba'i gos dag go //
translated: The phrase they wear the comfort of Dharma robes means that they wear the robes that are worn by those who are diligent in their vows.

original: de dag bde bar 'chag par byed pa dang // zhes bya ba ni de dag gi 'chag cing rgyu ba yang bde ba dang kha na ma tho ba med par 'chag pa'o //
analyzed: de dag bde bar 'chag par byed pa dang // zhes bya ba ni de dag gi 'chag cing rgyu ba yang bde ba dang kha na ma tho ba med par 'chag pa'o //
translated: The phrase they walk in comfort means that their walking and moving about is comfortable and free of any offense.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where do they do this?

original: ri dang nags tshal na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ri dang nags tshal na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text states, on mountains and in forests.

original: ri ni ri bo dag tu'o //
analyzed: ri ni ri bo dag tu'o //
translated: Mountains are mountains.

original: nags tshal ni dgon pa dag tu 'o //
analyzed: nags tshal ni dgon pa dag tu 'o //
translated: Forests are wildernesses.

original: de dag ba de 'thob ces bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i lam 'thob la skyong zhing zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ba de 'thob ces bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i lam 'thob la skyong zhing zhugs pa'o //
translated: The phrase they attain that refers to the attainment of the path that is desired and the maintenance of that attainment.

original: bde bar na zhes bya ba ni bde ba yang dag par skyes pa ste /
analyzed: bde bar na zhes bya ba ni bde ba yang dag par skyes pa ste /
translated: The phrase they are happy means that they have generated true happiness.

original: mthong ba'i chos la dga' ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la dga' ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: They are endowed with delight in this very life.

original: mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan 'das //
translated: They attain nirvana in this very life.

original: zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos nyid la rang gi lus yod bzhin du mngon par 'dod pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos nyid la rang gi lus yod bzhin du mngon par 'dod pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase they attain nirvana in this very life means that they experience the happiness of nirvana, which is desired, while their bodies remain in this life.

original: 'di nyid ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di nyid ga las she na /
translated: How is this so?

original: 'di ltar / kho na dang 'jigs pa kun 'das shing //
analyzed: 'di ltar / kho na dang 'jigs pa kun 'das shing //
translated: The verse states, They transcend all fear and danger.

original: zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they have abandoned all the secondary mental afflictions.

original: ji ltar byas pas de ltar 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas de ltar 'gyur zhe na //
translated: How is this so?

original: 'jig rten yul gyi sred las rgal //
analyzed: 'jig rten yul gyi sred las rgal //
translated: The verse states, They transcend craving for objects in the world.

original: zhes bya ba nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba sred pa drungs phyung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba sred pa drungs phyung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because craving is the root of the afflictions and secondary afflictions, it is uprooted.

original: srid pa spangs bas yon tan 'thob cing dga' ba la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: srid pa spangs bas yon tan 'thob cing dga' ba la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: By abandoning existence, one attains the qualities and possesses the distinctions of joy, etc.

original: des na yang chos thos pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: des na yang chos thos pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one hears the Dharma, etc.

original: dus ma yin pa'i sprin zhag bdun gyi bar du byung nas klu'i rgyal po btang bzung gis bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la gdengs ka chen po byas te lan bdun du 'khyud nas gnas so //
analyzed: dus ma yin pa'i sprin zhag bdun gyi bar du byung nas klu'i rgyal po btang bzung gis bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la gdengs ka chen po byas te lan bdun du 'khyud nas gnas so //
translated: An untimely cloud arose for seven days. The nƒÅga king Tak·π£aka coiled his great hood around the body of the Blessed One and embraced him seven times.

original: zhag @151b bdun 'das pa dang bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la 'khyud pa btang nas thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: zhag @151b bdun 'das pa dang bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la 'khyud pa btang nas thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: After seven days had passed, he released his embrace of the Blessed One's body, joined his palms, and said this:

original: btsun pa khyed zhag bdun po 'di la grang bar ma gyur tam /
analyzed: btsun pa khyed zhag bdun po 'di la grang bar ma gyur tam /
translated: Venerable One, were you not cold during these seven days?

original: tsha bar ma gyur tam /
analyzed: tsha bar ma gyur tam /
translated: Were you not hot?

original: sprang bu dang / sha sbrang dang / sdig sprul gyis reg par ma gyur tam /
analyzed: sprang bu dang / sha sbrang dang / sdig sprul gyis reg par ma gyur tam /
translated: Were you not touched by flies, mosquitoes, and poisonous snakes?

original: lus yongs su gdung bar ma gyur tam zhes zhus pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: lus yongs su gdung bar ma gyur tam zhes zhus pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'di gsungs so //
translated: and he spoke these two verses:

original: bde pa ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bde ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: bde pa ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bde ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: Happiness is the cause of happiness that is free from evil.

original: dben pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dben pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Seclusion is of two kinds:

original: de'i bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of that happiness.

original: 'di gang gi bde ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di gang gi bde ba yin zhe na /
translated: If one asks, Whose happiness is this?

original: dga' bas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dga' bas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said, through joy.

original: chos gos ngan don tsam dag gis yongs su chog shes pa ste /
analyzed: chos gos ngan don tsam dag gis yongs su chog shes pa ste /
translated: It is the contentment that comes from having only the most inferior robes, etc.

original: dben pa na chog mi shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dben pa na chog mi shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no discontent in seclusion.

original: chen po 'dod pa la chog mi shes pa med pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: chen po 'dod pa la chog mi shes pa med pa'o zhes so //
translated: It is the absence of discontent with the great desire.

original: chos thos pa dang zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i chos te /
analyzed: chos thos pa dang zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i chos te /
translated: The happiness of hearing the Dharma is the Dharma that is heard,

original: gang sngon thub pas bstan pa'i chos so //
analyzed: gang sngon thub pas bstan pa'i chos so //
translated: that is, the Dharma that was taught by the Muni in the past.

original: mang du thos pa dang dben pa'i bde ba ni rgyun du chos du ma yongs su rtogs pa las 'jug pa'i phyir thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mang du thos pa dang dben pa'i bde ba ni rgyun du chos du ma yongs su rtogs pa las 'jug pa'i phyir thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The happiness of hearing much and the happiness of seclusion are the wisdom that comes from hearing, because they are engaged in the realization of many aspects of the Dharma continuously.

original: mthong ba ni zhes bya ba ni shes bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: mthong ba ni zhes bya ba ni shes bar byed pa ste /
translated: Seeing is the cause of understanding,

original: yongs su rtogs par byed pa nyid de bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su rtogs par byed pa nyid de bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the knowledge that arises from reflection.

original: 'jig rten 'tshe med bde ba yin //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'tshe med bde ba yin //
translated: The world is happy with non-violence.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'tshe ba gzhan la gnod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'tshe ba gzhan la gnod pa byed pa'o //
translated: Violence is the harm of others.

original: de dgag pa ni 'tshe ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de dgag pa ni 'tshe ba med pa'o //
translated: Non-violence is the negation of that.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: To whom?

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba sems can la ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba sems can la ste /
translated: To the world, i.e., to sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad la byams pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la byams pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: The word ‚Äúall‚Äù refers to all sentient beings.

original: de ni gzhal du med pa'i bde ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni gzhal du med pa'i bde ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is the cause of immeasurable happiness,

original: bde ba'i sman bsten pas bde ba ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bde ba'i sman bsten pas bde ba ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: like the happiness that comes from relying on a medicine for happiness.

original: 'dis ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa bstan to //

translated: This is the inference of the afflicted mind.

original: ci de nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nyon mongs par gyur pa'i sems de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci de nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nyon mongs par gyur pa'i sems de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the mind that is afflicted by the mental afflictions and the secondary mental afflictions?

original: dad pa med pa'i zhes smos te /
analyzed: dad pa med pa'i zhes smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúIt is the mind that lacks faith . . .‚Äù

original: ma dad pas yongs su bzung bas so //
analyzed: ma dad pas yongs su bzung bas so //
translated: It is held by lack of faith.

original: sdang ba zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sdang ba zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is hostile‚Äù means it is associated with hatred.

original: 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i phra rgyas rnam par 'khrugs par byed pas g-yeng ba rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i phra rgyas rnam par 'khrugs par byed pas g-yeng ba rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is agitated‚Äù means it is associated with various kinds of distraction because it is agitated by the other negative mental traits.

original: yang na dam pa'i chos la @169b gus pa ma bskyed pas so //üîΩdam chos kun shes mi nus so //
analyzed: yang na dam pa'i chos la @169b gus pa ma bskyed pas so // dam chos kun shes mi nus so //
translated: Alternatively, it is because it does not generate respect for the true Dharma.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos bstan pa shes par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos bstan pa shes par mi nus pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is incapable of understanding the true Dharma‚Äù means it is incapable of understanding the teachings of the Dharma.

original: dam pa'i chos de ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩrdzogs sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa yin //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos de ji lta bu zhe na / rdzogs sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa yin //
translated: What is the true Dharma?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúIt is that which is taught by the Completely Enlightened One . . .‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is that which is spoken by the TathƒÅgata.

original: khro ba rnam par btul ba dang // zhes bya ba ni nyan pa pos phrag dog la sogs pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pas byas pa'i yid kun du 'khrug pa rnam par spangs pa'o //üîΩgang gis ma dad sems dang ni //
analyzed: khro ba rnam par btul ba dang // zhes bya ba ni nyan pa pos phrag dog la sogs pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pas byas pa'i yid kun du 'khrug pa rnam par spangs pa'o // gang gis ma dad sems dang ni //
translated: The phrase having subdued anger means that the listener has eliminated the mental disturbance created by the secondary defilement of envy.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems dang 'brel pa'i ma dad pa dang // ma dad pa rnam par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems dang 'brel pa'i ma dad pa dang // ma dad pa rnam par spangs pa'o //
translated: The phrase having eliminated the mind of lack of faith means that the listener has eliminated the lack of faith that is associated with the mind.

original: gnod sems rab spangs pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhe sdang dang rjes su 'brel pa spangs pa'o //üîΩdes ni legs par bshad pa shes //
analyzed: gnod sems rab spangs pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhe sdang dang rjes su 'brel pa spangs pa'o // des ni legs par bshad pa shes //
translated: The phrase having eliminated malice means that the listener has eliminated the attitude that is associated with hatred.

original: zhes bya ba ni de nyid legs par bshad pa thos par rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de nyid legs par bshad pa thos par rigs pa yin te /
translated: The phrase he knows what is well spoken means that he is worthy to hear the Dharma that is well spoken.

original: snod yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snod yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is a suitable vessel.

original: gang de nyid ni shes rab yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhing de nyid dul ba'i sems yin no //
analyzed: gang de nyid ni shes rab yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhing de nyid dul ba'i sems yin no //
translated: The phrase he is one who has perfected wisdom means that he is one who has a disciplined mind.

original: de ltar na gang shes rab yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur zhe na /üîΩsems kyi brtan pa med pa yis //
analyzed: de ltar na gang shes rab yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur zhe na / sems kyi brtan pa med pa yis //
translated: In what way does one not perfect wisdom?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase because of the instability of mind and so on.

original: btsun pa sems pa'am brtan pa gang gis shes rab yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhes zhus pa las brtsams so //
analyzed: btsun pa sems pa'am brtan pa gang gis shes rab yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhes zhus pa las brtsams so //
translated: The venerable one asked, By what mind or by what steadfastness does wisdom become perfected?

original: brtan pa med pa ni gnas pa med pa'i sems 'di la yod pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa med pa ni gnas pa med pa'i sems 'di la yod pa'o //
translated: The mind that lacks steadfastness is the mind that lacks stability.

original: dam chos rnam par shes mi nus //
analyzed: dam chos rnam par shes mi nus //
translated: One is unable to understand the true Dharma.

original: zhes bya ba ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi tshig dang don la mkhas par ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi tshig dang don la mkhas par ro //
translated: One is skilled in the words and meanings of the twelve branches of scripture.

original: dad pa 'gyur ldog byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni kun nas 'gyur zhing ldog pa ste myur du 'gro zhing 'khor ba'i chu bo ltar de la 'gyur zhing ldog pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa 'gyur ldog byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni kun nas 'gyur zhing ldog pa ste myur du 'gro zhing 'khor ba'i chu bo ltar de la 'gyur zhing ldog pa'o //
translated: Faith that vacillates means that it turns around and changes quickly, like the current of a river. It turns around and changes on that.

original: de'i dad pa ni gus pa mi brtan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dad pa ni gus pa mi brtan pa'o //
translated: That faith is not steadfast respect.

original: shes rab yongs su rdzogs mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i shes pa skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab yongs su rdzogs mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i shes pa skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Wisdom does not become perfected.

original: rgyu gsum gyis shes rab yongs su rdzogs par 'dod de /
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis shes rab yongs su rdzogs par 'dod de /
translated: Wisdom is considered perfected by three causes.

original: dam pa'i chos nyan pa la zhugs pa dang / brtan pa dang skye mched kyi rnam pa dang bas so //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nyan pa la zhugs pa dang / brtan pa dang skye mched kyi rnam pa dang bas so //
translated: and one who has undertaken to listen to the holy Dharma, and who is endowed with the aspects of the sense-fields.

original: de med na ni ji ltar de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de med na ni ji ltar de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /
translated: If one does not have these, how can one perfect wisdom?

original: de yang bshad pa /
analyzed: de yang bshad pa /
translated: This is also explained:

original: shes pa mi g-yo spun zla ste /
analyzed: shes pa mi g-yo spun zla ste /
translated: The unmoving mind is a friend,

original: dam chos nyan pa bla ma @170a * //
analyzed: dam chos nyan pa bla ma @170a * //
translated: listening to the holy Dharma is a guru,

original: yin ; / dad pa dri med mdza' bshes te //
analyzed: yin ; / dad pa dri med mdza' bshes te //
translated: faith is a stainless friend,

original: gang de yis ni rnam 'phel 'gyur //
analyzed: gang de yis ni rnam 'phel 'gyur //
translated: and that which increases is wisdom.

original: zhes so // yang na ma dul bas ni legs par gsungs pa mnyan pa yang med na shes rab yongs su rdzogs par lta gal yod ces bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes so // yang na ma dul bas ni legs par gsungs pa mnyan pa yang med na shes rab yongs su rdzogs par lta gal yod ces bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, if one is not disciplined, one does not listen to the well-spoken, so how can one perfect wisdom?

original: sems kyi brtan pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems kyi brtan pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúThe mind is unstable,‚Äù and so on.

original: ma dul ba de la ni dam pa'i chos mi mnyan pa'i phyir dang / de med pa'i phyir skye mched kyi rnam pas dad pa yang med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: ma dul ba de la ni dam pa'i chos mi mnyan pa'i phyir dang / de med pa'i phyir skye mched kyi rnam pas dad pa yang med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The condensed meaning is this: for one who is undisciplined, there is no listening to the holy Dharma, and because of that, there is no faith with the aspects of the sense-fields.

original: yid ma dul ba las ni ston gyi zla ba dri ma med pa lta bu'i grags pa yang nyams pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yid ma dul ba las ni ston gyi zla ba dri ma med pa lta bu'i grags pa yang nyams pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: But from an undisciplined mind, even the fame of the spotless autumn moon will be destroyed.

original: kun rtog la chums zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: kun rtog la chums zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:

original: rgyal po'i bu su mu kha zhes bya bas bcom ldan 'das la btsun pa gang gis grags pa nyams par 'gyur zhes zhus pa las de nas tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyal po'i bu su mu kha zhes bya bas bcom ldan 'das la btsun pa gang gis grags pa nyams par 'gyur zhes zhus pa las de nas tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
translated: The son of a king named Sumukha asked the Lord, ‚ÄúVenerable One, by what is fame destroyed?‚Äù Then two verses were spoken.

original: gang zag gang gis sum cu rtsa drug gi chu bo'i rgyun 'jug pa gang yin pa ste de ni zhes bya ba ni nyid kyi don te de nyid grags pa nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang zag gang gis sum cu rtsa drug gi chu bo'i rgyun 'jug pa gang yin pa ste de ni zhes bya ba ni nyid kyi don te de nyid grags pa nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy which person‚Äù means by which person the flow of the thirty-six rivers is engaged. ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means just that. Fame is destroyed.

original: yang na dang gi sgras ni rim pa gzhan du sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na dang gi sgras ni rim pa gzhan du sbyar ro //
translated: Or, the word ‚Äúand‚Äù is connected in another order.

original: lta ngan kun rtog ces bya ba 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: lta ngan kun rtog ces bya ba 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAll bad views are conceptualizations‚Äù should be understood in this way.

original: 'dis sred pa sum cu rtsa drug la spyod par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis sred pa sum cu rtsa drug la spyod par bstan to //
translated: Thus it is shown that he engages in the thirty-six cravings.

original: de yang ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa gzhan ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa chu bo'i rgyun sum cu rtsa drug go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de yang ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa gzhan ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa chu bo'i rgyun sum cu rtsa drug go zhes zer ro //
translated: The Blessed One has said that there are thirty-six streams of defilement in the realm of desire.

original: yid kyi rgyun zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'dzag pa yin pas rgyun te gang la rgyun rab tu 'bab pa zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩyid ni sems te de'i rgyun ni gang dag rab tu 'dzag pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rgyun zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'dzag pa yin pas rgyun te gang la rgyun rab tu 'bab pa zhes bya ba'i don to // yid ni sems te de'i rgyun ni gang dag rab tu 'dzag pa ste /
translated: The stream of mind is a flow, because it flows. The meaning is that it flows continuously.

original: sems la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind is the thought. Its stream is that which flows, because it is based on the mind.

original: brgya la 'di nyid rab tu 'bab pa yin nam ma yin zhes rtog pa las rab tu 'bab ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: brgya la 'di nyid rab tu 'bab pa yin nam ma yin zhes rtog pa las rab tu 'bab ces bya ba smos te /
translated: It is asked whether this is a flow or not. The word ‚Äúflow‚Äù is used because it flows.

original: shin tu 'bab cing rgyun mi 'chad pas so //
analyzed: shin tu 'bab cing rgyun mi 'chad pas so //
translated: It flows very well, without interruption.

original: yang na rab tu ni shin tu ste /
analyzed: yang na rab tu ni shin tu ste /
translated: Or else, ‚Äúvery‚Äù means ‚Äúcompletely.‚Äù

original: rgyun gyi shugs yang dang yang du 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyun gyi shugs yang dang yang du 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the force of the stream enters again and again.

original: lta ngan kun rtog ces bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa ste lta ba ngan pa la 'jug pa /
analyzed: lta ngan kun rtog ces bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa ste lta ba ngan pa la 'jug pa /
translated: The expression ‚Äúbad views and thoughts‚Äù refers to the bad views beginning with the view of the transitory composite.

original: rnam par rtog pa sna tshogs pa rab tu skye zhing lta ba ngan pa la @170b 'jug pa'i kun du rtog pa ni lta ngan kun rtog ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa sna tshogs pa rab tu skye zhing lta ba ngan pa la @170b 'jug pa'i kun du rtog pa ni lta ngan kun rtog ces bya ba ste /
translated: The conception that generates various discursive thoughts and engages in bad views is the conception of bad views.

original: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa pi ling btung ba bzhin no //üîΩyang na dang gi sgra ni 'dir lhag ma yin te chu bo'i rgyun byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa gcig pur ma zad de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa pi ling btung ba bzhin no // yang na dang gi sgra ni 'dir lhag ma yin te chu bo'i rgyun byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa gcig pur ma zad de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: The middle term is elided, as in the expression ‚Äúdrink pili.‚ÄùüîΩOr else, the word ‚Äúand‚Äù has a residual force here. It is not only the conception that generates the stream of discursive thought, but also the conception that is based on craving.

original: chums la rten pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chums la rten pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What is that?üîΩThe conception of desire that is associated with material things, which is based on craving.

original: sred pa la brten pa'i zang zing dang bcas pa'i 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sred pa la brten pa'i zang zing dang bcas pa'i 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the expression.

original: de ni skyes bu'i grags pa nyams par byed do zhes bya ba dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni skyes bu'i grags pa nyams par byed do zhes bya ba dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It is to be supplied with the phrase ‚Äúit causes a person‚Äôs good reputation to decline.‚Äù

original: de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that like?

original: dga' sems zhes smos te sred pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i 'dod chags dang yang dag par ldan pa ste /
analyzed: dga' sems zhes smos te sred pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i 'dod chags dang yang dag par ldan pa ste /
translated: The text says, ‚Äúthe mind that delights,‚Äù which is associated with attachment that is concomitant with craving.

original: yid bde ba 'dod cing 'dod pa'i ro myang bas rjes su chags pa'i sems so //
analyzed: yid bde ba 'dod cing 'dod pa'i ro myang bas rjes su chags pa'i sems so //
translated: The mind that is attached to the taste of desire, seeking mental satisfaction.

original: dbang po phal pa dang zhes bya ba ni dbang po zhan pa'am dbang po ma dul ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po phal pa dang zhes bya ba ni dbang po zhan pa'am dbang po ma dul ba'o //
translated: The word ordinary refers to a weak faculty or an untrained faculty.

original: 'dis ni dga' ba'i sems kyi rgyu bstan te blo zhan pa yin na ni dga' ba nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dis ni dga' ba'i sems kyi rgyu bstan te blo zhan pa yin na ni dga' ba nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: This shows the cause of a joyful mind. If one has a weak mind, joy diminishes.

original: ma dul ba'i dbang po la ni dbang po tha mal par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ma dul ba'i dbang po la ni dbang po tha mal par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that an untrained faculty becomes an ordinary faculty.

original: sems kyi rjes 'brang zhes bya ba ni sems kyi dbang ste 'dod pa'i rgyu la spyod pa gang ma dul ba'i sems zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems kyi rjes 'brang zhes bya ba ni sems kyi dbang ste 'dod pa'i rgyu la spyod pa gang ma dul ba'i sems zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase following the mind means being under the power of the mind. It means that one whose mind is untrained engages in the causes of desire.

original: 'grib pa ni yongs su nyams pa'o //
analyzed: 'grib pa ni yongs su nyams pa'o //
translated: The word diminution means deterioration.

original: grags pa ni snyan pa'o //
analyzed: grags pa ni snyan pa'o //
translated: The word fame means good reputation.

original: gzhan yang 'dir skyes bu'i khyad par smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dir skyes bu'i khyad par smras pa /
translated: Moreover, here a distinction of persons is mentioned.

original: zhan pa'i mthus zhes bya ba smos te mthu dang smra ba dman par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhan pa'i mthus zhes bya ba smos te mthu dang smra ba dman par gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase through the power of weakness means that one's power and speech become weak.

original: mthun pa'i chos kyi dpe bstan pa /
analyzed: mthun pa'i chos kyi dpe bstan pa /
translated: The teaching of examples for the Dharma of agreement.

original: ljon shing zhes bya ba ste de nyid do //
analyzed: ljon shing zhes bya ba ste de nyid do //
translated: The tree is the same as the one mentioned above.

original: 'bras bu lhags pa yin zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu thams cad lhung ba yin pa'i phyir mngon par mi bsngags pa'o /
analyzed: 'bras bu lhags pa yin zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu thams cad lhung ba yin pa'i phyir mngon par mi bsngags pa'o /
translated: The fallen fruit is the fruit that has fallen down, and is not fit to be eaten.

original: bya bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'dab chags ji lta ba bzhin te /
analyzed: bya bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'dab chags ji lta ba bzhin te /
translated: The bird is the one that flies in the sky.

original: de ni 'bras bu la brkam pas shing la rgyu ste de med par gyur na ni yongs su spong ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu la brkam pas shing la rgyu ste de med par gyur na ni yongs su spong ba yin no //
translated: Because of its greed for fruit, it goes to the tree, but when it is gone, it abandons it.

original: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa'i yon tan dang skyon gyi gnas pa'i rgyud kyi sems can gyi grags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa'i yon tan dang skyon gyi gnas pa'i rgyud kyi sems can gyi grags pa med pa'o //
translated: In the same way, people who are greedy for the praise of others, who are attached to the praise of their own good qualities, and who are averse to the criticism of their faults, are like that bird.

original: sems ma dul ba nyid kyis 'dis nyes dmigs bstan nas /
analyzed: sems ma dul ba nyid kyis 'dis nyes dmigs bstan nas /
translated: Because of the undisciplined mind, this is the fault.

original: 'jig rten phyi ma'i smras pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten phyi ma'i smras pa /
translated: The next verse is about the next world.

original: sems khyod ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems khyod ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The verse begins, Mind, you have brought me to this state...

original: nags dgon pa zhig na le lo che zhing bag med la 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pas rnam par gtses pa'i dge slong zhig las brtsams so //
analyzed: nags dgon pa zhig na le lo che zhing bag med la 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pas rnam par gtses pa'i dge slong zhig las brtsams so //
translated: The story is about a monk who was very lazy, careless, and tormented by thoughts of desire, living in a certain forest.

original: @171a * // brtson la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus khyad par can dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @171a * // brtson la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus khyad par can dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúDwelling in effort‚Äù means being endowed with special effort.

original: ma bsags pa'i dge ba bsags pa'i rgyu bstan nas bsags pa'i dge ba bsrung ba'i thabs bstan pa /
analyzed: ma bsags pa'i dge ba bsags pa'i rgyu bstan nas bsags pa'i dge ba bsrung ba'i thabs bstan pa /
translated: Having taught the cause for accumulating virtue that was not previously accumulated, he teaches the method for protecting the virtue that was accumulated:

original: bag yod sems zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bag yod sems zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúMindful, you should not delight in the faults of the mind.‚Äù

original: bag yod pa'i khyad par gyi yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bag yod pa'i khyad par gyi yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This means being endowed with the special qualities of mindfulness.

original: yon tan nyams pa dang skyon skye ba'i rgyu las bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan nyams pa dang skyon skye ba'i rgyu las bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: The cause for the degeneration of good qualities and the arising of faults is reversed.

original: sems khyod phung khrol 'dod la dga' ma byed //üîΩces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems khyod phung khrol 'dod la dga' ma byed // ces bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúYou should not delight in the faults of the mind, O mind!‚Äù

original: yid khyod 'dod pa'i sred pa dang phung khrol ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: yid khyod 'dod pa'i sred pa dang phung khrol ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: This means, ‚ÄúYou should not delight in the craving for desire and the faults of the mind, O mind!‚Äù

original: de ni mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bstan pas bzlog pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bstan pas bzlog pa yin te /
translated: This is a reversal through teaching the undesirable result.

original: bag med lcags gong med pas zhes bya ba bag med pa'i rgyus lcags kyi thu lum rab tu 'bar ba za bar ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: bag med lcags gong med pas zhes bya ba bag med pa'i rgyus lcags kyi thu lum rab tu 'bar ba za bar ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúYou should not eat the blazing iron ball of heedlessness.‚Äù This means, ‚ÄúYou should not eat the blazing iron ball through the cause of heedlessness.‚Äù

original: dmyal bar btsos pa na zhes bya ba ni dmyal bar skyes nas dmyal ba'i mes bsregs par gyur pa na /
